availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jeremiah "Jerry" Turner (Metcalfe County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in the 37th KY)

body.p: Metcalfe County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ann Strong Turner in Cumberland County, Kentucky, on July 20, 1852. Father of William R. Turner, Dosha R. Turner, Louisa J. Turner, and Francis M. Turner. Farmer in Metcalfe County in 1860. Served in Company K 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from December 21, 1863, to February 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Metcalfe County, p. 859.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 420.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994032, Cumberland County Marriages, p. 1.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 382.
"Jeremiah Turner (1825-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #124794254, accessed January 7, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124794254.
